physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No murmur or other abnormalities were found; the blood pressure was 105/70 mm Hg.
A new systolic murmur was heard, trace-to-mild tricuspid insufficiency was noted, and a multilobular mass of echoes (4.3 by 3.1 cm) that invaded the tricuspid annulus was present.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Segmental right ventricular dysfunction was present without dilatation. There was a moderate pericardial effusion.

physical_examinations.date: Eight weeks after the start of chemotherapy
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The right atrial mass had decreased in size to 1.7 by 3.0 cm and no longer obstructed the tricuspid valve; pericardium appeared free of disease.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The left ventricular ejection fraction decreased from 60 percent to 45 percent after chemotherapy.
